node.title: Less than half of UK prescriptions for antipsychotics issued for main licensed conditions
node.excerpt:
Less than half of UK prescriptions for antipsychotic drugs are being issued to treat the serious mental illnesses for which they are mainly licensed, reveals research published in BMJ Open. Instead, they may often be prescribed ‘off label’  to older people with other conditions, such as anxiety and dementia, despite the greater risk of potentially serious side effects in this age group, […]

node.title: Skirt size increase linked to 33% greater postmenopausal breast cancer risk
node.excerpt:
Going up a skirt size over a period of 10 years between your mid 20s and mid 50s is linked to a 33% greater risk of developing breast cancer after the menopause, finds a large observational study published in BMJ Open.
